Pre-Game Insights: Hong Kong entered into this tournament as one of the weakest teams and while they started their campaign on Sunday with a 3-1 defeat at the hands of Group C rivals the United Arab Emirates, they put plenty on show to suggest they aren't just there to make up the numbers in what was their first Asian Cup finals game since 1968.

Iran were without the services of Ali Gholizadeh for their opener due to an injury. AS Roma striker Sardar Azmoun scored his 50th goal for the national team last weekend, taking him into joint second in the all-time scorer's list alongside Karim Bagheri, with Ali Daei holding the outright record with 108.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The AFC Asian Cup match between Vietnam and Indonesia will be played at the Khalifa International Stadium in Al Rayyan, Qatar.
It will kick off at 12:30 pm ET on Friday, January 19, 2024, in the United States (US).
Others: Sean Tse missed Hong Kong's opening match owing to a thigh issue, while Helio was also out due to a muscle injury.
Hong Kong possible XI: Fai; Nam, Gerbig, Hoi, Chan; Ming, Wai, Kwan; Camargo, Orr, Udebuluzor.
Iran possible XI: Beiranvand; Hosseini, Kanaanizadegan, Khalilzadeh, Hajsafi; Cheshmi, Ebrahimi; Jahanbakhsh, Taremi, Ghayedi; Ansarifard.
